pages.h1: Midjourney Upscaler - Enhance Your AI Images to 4K
pages.intro: Midjourney creates stunning AI art, but its default resolution may not be enough for professional use, large prints, or high-quality displays. Our specialized Midjourney upscaler enhances your images to 4K resolution while preserving the unique artistic style and details that make AI-generated art special.
pages.description: Specialized upscaling for Midjourney AI-generated images, enhancing resolution while preserving artistic style and details.

Export or save the image in PNG format (highest quality available)
Upload to our upscaler and select your target resolution (2x, 4x, or custom)
Choose enhancement level based on your use case (web, print, or ultra-high-res)
Download your enhanced 4K Midjourney image ready for use

faq.question: Why do I need to upscale Midjourney images?
faq.answer: Midjourney's default resolution (1024x1024 or higher for v5+) may not be sufficient for professional printing, large format displays, or high-quality applications. Upscaling enhances detail while maintaining the artistic style.

faq.question: Will upscaling change my Midjourney image's style?
faq.answer: Our upscaler is designed to preserve the original artistic style and aesthetic qualities of your Midjourney images while enhancing resolution and sharpness.

faq.question: What's the best format to export from Midjourney?
faq.answer: PNG format provides the highest quality for upscaling. Avoid JPEG if possible, as compression artifacts can be amplified during the upscaling process.

faq.question: Can I upscale Midjourney grid images?
faq.answer: Yes, but for best results, first use Midjourney's upscale feature to get individual high-res images, then enhance them further with our upscaler.

faq.question: Does this work with Midjourney Niji (anime) images?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Our upscaler works excellently with Niji images, preserving the anime style while enhancing line quality and details.

faq.question: Can I print upscaled Midjourney images?
faq.answer: Yes, upscaled images are suitable for printing. We recommend 4x upscaling for standard prints and 8x for large format posters and canvas prints.

faq.question: How big can I upscale my Midjourney images?
faq.answer: You can upscale up to 8x the original resolution. For Midjourney v5+ images (1024x1024), this means outputs up to 8192x8192 pixels.

faq.question: Does upscaling fix Midjourney artifacts?
faq.answer: Our upscaler can reduce certain compression artifacts and enhance overall clarity, but it won't fundamentally alter or 'fix' the original AI generation choices.

Use Hi-Res Fix or higher resolution settings for better starting quality
Save the output in PNG format without compression
Upload to our upscaler and select your target resolution
Download your enhanced high-resolution SD image

faq.question: What resolution should I generate at in Stable Diffusion?
faq.answer: For best upscaling results, use SDXL's native 1024x1024, or enable Hi-Res Fix in SD 1.5. Higher starting resolution yields better upscaled results.

faq.question: Can I upscale images from specific SD checkpoints?
faq.answer: Yes! Our upscaler works with images from any SD checkpoint or LoRA, preserving the unique style characteristics of each model.

faq.question: Does this work with SDXL images?
faq.answer: Absolutely. SDXL's native 1024x1024 resolution is a great starting point, and our upscaler can enhance it further to 4K and beyond.

faq.question: Will upscaling add detail to my SD images?
faq.answer: Our upscaler enhances existing details and sharpens the image, but it doesn't 'hallucinate' new details that weren't in the original generation.

faq.question: Can I upscale anime-style Stable Diffusion images?
faq.answer: Yes, our upscaler works excellently with anime-style models and checkpoints, preserving line quality and cel-shading techniques.

faq.question: What about img2img outputs?
faq.answer: img2img outputs work great with our upscaler. Just ensure you save at the highest quality setting available.

faq.question: Can I use this with ControlNet outputs?
faq.answer: Yes, ControlNet images upscale well. The structural guidance from ControlNet is preserved in the upscaled output.

faq.question: How does this compare to SD's built-in upscaler?
faq.answer: Our upscaler focuses on print-quality output and artifact reduction, complementing SD's internal upscaling. Many artists use both.

faq.question: Does this work with DALL-E 3 images?
faq.answer: Yes! Our upscaler is optimized for both DALL-E 2 and DALL-E 3, enhancing the improved detail and texture rendering in DALL-E 3 outputs.

faq.question: What's the best way to export from DALL-E?
faq.answer: Download images directly from ChatGPT in PNG format when available. Avoid taking screenshots, as they reduce quality.

faq.question: Can I upscale rectangular DALL-E images?
faq.answer: Yes, we support both the classic square format and DALL-E 3's rectangular outputs.

faq.question: Will upscaling improve DALL-E's text rendering?
faq.answer: Upscaling sharpens existing text, making it clearer, but won't fix spelling errors that were in the original generation.

faq.question: Can I print upscaled DALL-E images?
faq.answer: Yes, 4K upscaled images are excellent for printing. We recommend testing a small print first to ensure quality meets your standards.

faq.question: Does this work with DALL-E via ChatGPT?
faq.answer: Absolutely. Images generated through ChatGPT's DALL-E integration work perfectly with our upscaler.

faq.question: What about DALL-E edit variations?
faq.answer: All DALL-E variations and edits can be upscaled. Each variation is treated as an independent image.

faq.question: Can I upscale DALL-E images for commercial use?
faq.answer: Yes, upscaled images maintain the same usage rights as the original DALL-E generation according to OpenAI's terms.

faq.question: Why do I need to upscale Canva designs?
faq.answer: Canva's free tier has resolution limits, and even Pro downloads may not be sufficient for large format printing or ultra-high-resolution displays.

faq.question: Will text stay sharp when upscaled?
faq.answer: Yes, our upscaler is specifically optimized to maintain text clarity in Canva designs, keeping fonts crisp and readable.

faq.question: Can I upscale designs with embedded photos?
faq.answer: Yes, both the design elements and any embedded photos are enhanced. Complex designs with mixed content work well.

faq.question: What's the best format to download from Canva?
faq.answer: PNG format provides the highest quality. Avoid downloading as JPEG if you plan to upscale, as compression artifacts will be amplified.

faq.question: Can I upscale for large format printing?
faq.answer: Yes, 4K-8K upscaled designs work well for posters, banners, and other large format print applications.

faq.question: Does this work with Canva Pro downloads?
faq.answer: Yes, and Pro's higher resolution starting point will yield even better upscaled results.

faq.question: Will colors remain accurate?
faq.answer: Our upscaler maintains color accuracy, important for brand materials and designs with specific color requirements.

faq.question: Can I upscale animated Canva designs?
faq.answer: For static exports, yes. For animated designs, export each frame individually, then reassemble after upscaling.

workflowSteps: Complete your editing work in Photoshop with layers flattened
Export using File > Export As - choose TIFF or PNG for best quality
Upload to our Photoshop-optimized upscaler
Select target resolution based on your output needs
Download your enhanced ultra-HD Photoshop image

faq.question: What's the best format to export from Photoshop?
faq.answer: TIFF (uncompressed) or PNG are ideal. Avoid JPEG compression if you plan to upscale, as artifacts will be amplified.

faq.question: Can I upscale layered PSD files?
faq.answer: Export flattened versions of each layer separately, then upscale individually. Layers maintain their relationship after enhancement.

faq.question: Does this work with smart objects?
faq.answer: Yes, but ensure smart objects are rasterized at the highest resolution before upscaling for best results.

faq.question: Can I upscale 16-bit or 32-bit images?
faq.answer: Yes, our upscaler supports high bit-depth images from Photoshop, preserving tonal range and color accuracy.

faq.question: What about CMYK images?
faq.answer: Yes, CMYK images for print can be upscaled. Color accuracy is preserved throughout the process.

faq.question: Can I upscale Photoshop Generative Fill results?
faq.answer: Absolutely. Gen Fill outputs work great with our upscaler for seamless enhancement.

faq.question: Will layer effects be preserved?
faq.answer: Layer effects must be baked into the image (flattened) before export, but their visual results are preserved in the upscaled output.

faq.question: Can I upscale for large format printing?
faq.answer: Yes, upscaled images are excellent for posters, banners, wall art, and other large format applications.
